data.title: Albéniz, Granados and Falla Thesis
data.meta_description: Albéniz, Granados and Falla Thesis - Free ebook download as PDF File (.pdf), Text File (.txt) or read book online for free. This doctoral thesis examines the authenticity and evolution of piano technique in Spanish piano music, focusing on the works of Isaac Albéniz, Enrique Granados, and Manuel de Falla. The thesis begins with an overview of Spanish music and its fundamental characteristics such as typical scales, rhythms, and dances. It then discusses the influence of Spanish idioms on orchestral and keyboard literature from other composers. The main body analyzes the development of the Spanish piano school from Domenico Scarlatti to Falla and his contemporaries. It also examines external factors like flamenco and the evolution of the guitar and clavichord that helped define an authentic Spanish style. The thesis concludes with analyses and interpretations of selected works,
